ai-tha-ap141:0.3_0: She gave the Elder Nun Sālaka
ai-tha-ap141:1.1_0: “I was a king, the king of Magadha,
ai-tha-ap141:1.2_0: When you’re born you live on a charnel ground,
ai-tha-ap141:1.3_0: I’ve been searching for a hill.
ai-tha-ap141:1.4_0: I saw the benefit of the world,
ai-tha-ap141:2.1_0: Now that hero, the great hero,
ai-tha-ap141:2.4_0: to the branch of the gods.
ai-tha-ap141:3.1_0: She a sal tree and broke.
ai-tha-ap141:3.2_0: I took a flower in my own flowers,
ai-tha-ap141:3.3_0: Having gone to the Awakened One
ai-tha-ap141:4.2_0: it was all over the flower.
ai-tha-ap141:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap141:4.4_0: this gift is the fruit of giving.
ai-tha-ap141:5.3_0: Three kings brought him the three Kings.
ai-tha-ap141:7.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Sālaka.
